data.event: Jefferson County was established on June 11, 1792, by William Blount, Governor of the Southwest Territory.
Its county seat, Dandridge, was settled in 1783.

event.title: Tennessee's Ordinance of Secession referendum on June 8, 1861

data.event: In Tennessee's Ordinance of Secession referendum on June 8, 1861, Jefferson County voters rejected secession by a margin of 1,987 to 603.

event.title: targeted by the East Tennessee bridge-burning conspiracy in November 1861

data.event: A railroad bridge at Strawberry Plains was among those targeted by the East Tennessee bridge-burning conspiracy in November 1861.
